result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary N Betley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Joint/Several with co-defendant Hunter Volk,   Rusk County case 14CF37

DE will have no contacts with the victims, Robert Grunseth, John Wilson, Andrew Olson nor co-defendant Hunter Volk.  
No alcohol/drugs without a prescription, no bars, taverns or liquor stores.
DE must write a letter of apology to victims, with  prior approval of letter from the District Attorney's Office.
Will be eligible for expunction upon successful completion of all cases.

records.addlTxt: Case settlement filed in 14CF28, WITH ATTACHED VICTIM WITNESS STATEMENT

Defendant Zachary N Betley in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF34, 14CF36.  Court recites case settlements into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  
14CF28-DE will enter a plea to amended Ct 1, and Ct 2.  Ct 3 will be dismissed but read in.  Will pay restitution of $29.53 J/S with co-defendant.
14CF34-DE will enter a plea to Ct 2.  Ct's 1 and 3 will be dismissed but read in.  DE will pay restitution of $125.00 J/S with co-defendant.
14CF36-DE will enter a plea to Ct 2.  Ct's 1 and 3 will be dismissed but read in.  DE will pay restitution of $1556.72 J/S with do-defendant.  
DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct's 1(amended) and 2 in 14CF28-  Ct 2 in 14CF34-  Ct 2 in 14CF36 .  Court will accept and find the DE guilty.  
Withhold sentence 2 yrs probation, will pay restitution as requested J/S with Hunter Volk, no contact with victims or their property, no contact with co-defendat no alcohol possession or consumption, no illicit drugs without a valid prescription, DE will write a letter of apology to victims, letter will be first approved by DA's office, will be eligible for expunction upon successful completion of all cases.  DE will pay CC.  The court will accept the recommendations of the parties.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Attorney Annette M. Barna in court.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 14CF34, 14CF36.  DE does not appear.  Set for 1-26-15 @ 3:00PM for plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Review hearing on December 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing on November 4, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Zachary N Betley in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF34, 14CF36.  Waive reading of the information, enter a plea of NG to all charges.  Atty possisbly looking at resolving cases with Sawyer County Case, set for review 11-04-14 @ 2;00PM, all cases.

Defendant Zachary N Betley in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Andrea Amidon Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF34, 14CF36.  DE will waive time limits for prelim hearing, court instructs on waiver of prelim.  Court is satisfied will accept waiver on all three cases.  Infomation filed this day by the State on all three cases.  Court finds probable cause exists on all cases, will bind over for JT.  Atty does not wish to proceed to arraignment at this time.  Set for 9-09-14 @ 2:00PM for arraignment, all cases.
with attached LETC from WI PD.

Defendant Zachary N Betley in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  Andrea A Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 14CF34, 14CF36.    Waive formal reading of Criminal Complaint.  State requests a $5000.00 sign bond on all cases no contact with Robert Grunseth, Hunter Volk, (14CF34)- John Wilson or  (14CF36)-Andrew Olson.  All bonds concurrent.  DE will waive time limits for prelim hearing, Court goes over waiver of time limits with DE, court is satisfied will accept waiver.  Set for 7-22-14 @ 11:00AM, prelim on all cases.
CONCURRENT WITH 14CF28 AND 14CF36.  NO CONTACT WITH JOHN WILSON.
Preliminary hearing on July 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.
